Text: Defining Big in Megawatt OwnershipBB Exchanges Seek to Avert An titrust TagEnergy Insight for Friday August In Energy Insight Today Blue Banner all subscribers With more power in the possession of fewer companies the amount of generating capacity a big utility needs to compete in the marketplace is rising Find out just how many tens of thousands of megawatts constitutes big these days including a list of the biggest at Also in Energy Insight Today European news headlines from FT Energys team of Londonbased editors In Energy Insight Red Banner premiumpay access only In Energy Insight Energy Services Energy industry businesstobusiness exchanges could save utilities millions of dollars in procurement and billing but first they must head off antitrust issues that have plagued other business sectors Details at In Energy Insight Fuels Environmental concerns about coal supply shortages in natural gas plus improvements in the efficiency and design of nuclear plants may equate to a rebound in uraniumfueled power Read about it at News Brief High Cost of Oil and Natural Gas Puts FPL Million Behind in Fuel Expense Recovery Faced with skyrocketing oil and natural gas prices and heavy seasonal demand for electricity Florida Power Light Company has filed preliminary paperwork with the Florida Public Service Commission identifying million in expenses above projections for fuel burned to produce electricity in FPL will file with the Commission in September for permission to recover the expense in customer bills beginning Jan Part of this increase will be offset by a refund to customers that is currently estimated to be million to million The refund is pursuant to an agreement reached in April with the Office of the Public Counsel and the FPSC that provides for revenue sharing between FPL and its customers as well as a annual rate reduction for three years As a result of the forecasted fuel costs and the expected rebate residential electric rates could increase by approximately per kilowatthour The cost of oil used to generate electricity has more than doubled since the first quarter of and has not been this high since the Gulf War in Since January oil prices have increased per barrel Natural gas prices also have risen unabated climbing since January With the onset of winter natural gas prices may increase further as demand for heating fuel increases
